item.title: Data Analytics Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Analyst

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms.  Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s).  Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit.  Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions.  Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

What will you do?

Analytics Lab Support

  • Assist in the creation and maintenance of foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors.

Business Case Development and Adoption Support

  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.

Technological use and Reuse

  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team.
  • Support global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis.

Leadership & People Development

  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors.

What do you need to succeed?

Overall

  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • Strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Knowledge of auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.

Technical experience:

  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Working knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Working knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Proficient data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark

Leadership and People Management experience:

  • Demonstrates they have successfully worked in inclusive and diverse work teams
  • Proven ability to multitask and prioritize activities; across borders and cultures
  • Experience working as a team member on a special project, over an extended period of time

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $65,000 - $105,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USAUDIT23

Job Summary

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals. These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-01-12-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-03-07-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​

item.title: Senior Manager, Everyday Banking Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Everyday Banking Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our Vision is to be Canadians’ leading choice for all payment and everyday banking activities, extending our market leading position through superior value, innovation, and differentiated experiences that drive acquisition and engagement.

In this role, you will be using data and analytics to improve our understanding of client behaviours, as well as improve in-market strategies and inform the design of our suite of products.

You will be working collaboratively with the broader Banking and Payments team, and use advanced analytical tools and multiple data sources (e.g. client segment data, bureau data, client behaviour data across all RBC products, online and mobile interaction data) in order to formulate strategies that optimize the business, enhance product construct, and provide value to our customers. Finally, you will be responsible for designing dashboards to support business reviews with Executives and complete deep dives to explain key trends and identify strategic opportunities.

What will you do?

  • Leverage complex data to provide analytics and strategic insights for business decisions and to explore new opportunities for Banking and Payments, including  
    • Detailed understanding of the product and segment analytics and financials
    • Business insight into acquisition and retention activities, channel performance and market share
    • Information in support of business optimization and business cases
    • Deep dives on new product innovation
    • Special projects as assigned
  • Work collaboratively with the Banking and Payments leadership team, and other analytics teams across the organization to enhance business decision-making through use of reporting, advanced analytics and combining multiple sources of data to measure key indicators of performance and early detection of opportunities, trends & anomalies.
  • Monitor and evaluate strategy effectiveness through the implementation of various tests (e.g. foundational testing, price optimization tests) and analysis on previous in-market tests and strategies.
  • Create materials to communicate the insights developed either through new monthly / quarterly reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions.
  • Work effectively with key stakeholders throughout the analytics and insights process to deliver high quality results aligned to the needs of the business.
  • Provide concise, timely and insightful reporting to senior management on relevant matters relating to Banking and Payments portfolio.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make data-based strategic decisions, while looking for opportunities to innovate.
  • Proficiency with data manipulation and analytical tools including Excel, SQL, SAS, Tableau, Python.
  • Proven ability to collaborate with a diverse set of stakeholders in defining and solving business problems.
  • Ability to be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environment.
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business, engineering) to demonstrate ability for critical thinking & numerical analytics.
  • 5+ years related work experience in analytics, product or quantitative strategy roles.

Nice to have:

  • Experience in building financial models /valuations
  • Experience with statistical tools, test design, and predictive analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Regular

Salaried

item.title: Manager, Stress Testing and Impairment Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Stress Testing and Impairment Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Stress Testing & Credit Provisioning team provides Senior Management within Risk Management, Finance, Business units (including: Capital Markets, Canadian Banking, I&TS, Wealth Management, Insurance, and legal entities) and Investor Relations with expert analysis and guidance on the Banks stress testing and credit provision, includes IFRS9, CECL and Stress testing program. 

Team also provides support for the review & analysis of RBC’s Enterprise Wide Stress Testing (EWST) results that are used in Board level risk appetite statements.

The Manager, Stress Testing & Credit Provisioning will be executing production reporting processes, evaluating SOX control and assisting to enhance process efficiencies and reduce operational risks. As the subject matter expert on IFRS9, CECL and EWST data, you will be interacting with model implementation teams to understand the data lineage for IFRS9, CECL and EWST calculations.

What will you do?

  • Assist in the execution and maintenance of time sensitive IFRS9 and CECL live production runs
  • Assist in maintaining reporting infrastructure for the analysis of IFRS9, CECL & Enterprise-Wide Stress Testing (EWST).
  • Assist in the timely production of the Allowance Committee decks that are critical for the approval of the allowances by the Committee. The reported numbers have a direct impact on the balance sheet and the income statements of every business line across RBC.
  • Working closely with Credit Provision Analysis and Measurement (CPAM), Stress Testing (ST), IFRS9 model and IFRS9 system teams, understand & deliver the required analyses and best practices for the reporting.
  • Continuously review and streamline current reporting processes and explore new technology for the enhancement.
  • Have a strong governance control mindset and attention to detail, to ensure correct and representative information is presented for internal & external reviews of allowances.

What do you need to succeed?

  • Undergraduate, and preferably graduate, degree in a quantitative discipline such as physics, mathematics, statistics, engineering, economics, econometrics, actuarial science, finance and/or relevant professional qualifications, with focus on quantitative statistical and analytical skills.
  • Minimal relevant business work experience in quant groups (risk, front office, etc.) in the financial industry. Academic and/or other industry experience will be considered based on relevance.
  • More than 3-5 years programming experience with tools such as SAS, Python Excel/VBA etc.
  • Knowledge of database structure and management (SQL, SAS, etc.).
  • Quick learner with outstanding conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills, with an ability to work towards challenging deadlines and deliver under pressure.

Nice to Have

  • Professional designation in Accounting, Finance or Risk Management is preferred, but not required – e.g. CPA, CFA, or FRM etc.
  • Strong ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts in non-technical terms to business segment Finance and senior business segment leaders.
  • Demonstrated self-starter and leader (versus solely a delegator) who can tailor analysis to required level of precision
  • A thorough understanding of relevant accounting and regulatory rules and requirements (IFRS 9, Basel) preferred.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

Monitors market risk and implements risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market. Applies extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Regular

item.title: VP/Sr. Manager, Deposit Product Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

VP/Sr. Manager, Deposit Product Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The role will

  • Contribute to the development of a competitive and sustainable pricing approach for USCM’s term deposits, demand deposits and current account in the mid-market corporate space
  • Support the execution of be-spoke and real-time pricing for large amount of corporate deposits in close partnership with relationship managers, sales and money market desk
  • Provide input to the overall pricing strategy focused on revenues across clients, deposits and other products at the total portfolio level
  • Recommend pricing strategies that help shape client, product and tenor mix to achieve a stable operational deposit base over time

US Cash Management USCM) Business is a unique opportunity to build the cash management business of the future from the ground up. This is an exciting time to join a start-up function within RBC, built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling RBC to compete with new entrants in this space!

What will you do?

  • Contribute to the development of a competitive and sustainable pricing approach for USCM’s term deposits, demand deposits and current account in the mid-market corporate space
  • Support the execution of be-spoke and real-time pricing for large amount of corporate deposits in close partnership with relationship managers, sales and money market desk
  • Provide input to the overall pricing strategy focused on revenues across clients, deposits and other products at the total portfolio level
  • Recommend pricing strategies that help shape client, product and tenor mix to achieve a stable operational deposit base over time

People Leadership & Collaboration

  • Works with team members to establish goals, drive performance management, support career development and reward strong performance.
  • Ability to forge strong relationships and routines with cross functional partners to drive strong business outcomes 

What you need to succeed?

  • At least 5 years of experience in the financial industry, with preference in Treasury, Cash Management or Transaction Banking.

  • Excellent knowledge of deposits liquidity value, rate beta quantification and funds transfer pricing of deposits
  • Fluent with deposits product offerings and competitive pricing in the target market
  • Good grasp of asset liability management and balance sheet hedging (Treasury / fixed income portfolio management experience is preferred)
  • Solid understanding of derivatives and tractor/bond ladder in relate to deposits hedging
  • High degree of business and financial acumen
  • Able to perform data-driven analytics including the synthesis of complex data into meaningful insights
  • Able to work with x-functional teams and functional partners to design an efficient process architecture that adheres to all RBC policies and controls.
  • Strong communication skills with ability to communicate complex messages, trade-offs and tell a compelling story
  • Have rigorous attention to detail with the ability to grasp big picture
  • Comfortable working with quick turnaround times and deadlines
  • Experience leading or shaping large transformational efforts preferred
  • Professional designation (CFA/FRM/MBA) and/or Master in quantitative fields is highly desirable

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Flexible work/life balance options

USACASHMGMT

item.title: 2023 GRM, Fall Global Risk Analytics (4 Months)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

2023 GRM, Fall Global Risk Analytics (4 Months)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Global Risk Analytics (GRA) is the center of expertise for models used in risk management. This includes risk analytics for market risk, counterparty credit risk and emerging risk. GRA’s analytics innovation team focuses on emerging risks, including machine learning and climate analytics.

Given the large size of market data, data analytics (e.g., using advanced techniques such as machine learning) are needed to provide business insights. In addition, having an intelligent data visualization platform would bring the analytical presentation to the next level. As a result, GRA is developing a Dashboard web application for this purpose. This web application would serve as a centralized platform to host various data analytics dashboards.

Further, due to increasing importance of assessing the impacts of climate change to financial institutions, GRA is also building expertise in climate risk analytics to support RBC’s various climate risk stress testing and scenario analysis mandates (e.g., CCAR in US, ICAAP in UK). In particular, GRA has the model development ownership for several regional climate risk scenario analysis models, covering both transition risk (posed to clients in transition to low-carbon economy) and physical risk (posed by acute weather events) for different asset classes (e.g., corporate bond, municipal bonds, real estate, and wholesale loans). 

Climate analytics is an emerging field. Institutions around the world (e.g., regulators, banks, vendors, etc.) are grappling with the challenges in how to enhance the data, scenario design, and methodology. At this stage, GRA is currently developing a unified platform to onboard different “climate risk + machine learning” modules, and potentially utilizing open-source data (if deemed appropriate) for research purposes.

GRA is seeking an individual who is interested in applying data analytics (including machine learning) and programming skills to empower our climate risk analytics capability. The intern student will be involved in researching open-source data platforms for climate risk, and developing Python-based tools for climate risk related analytics and machine learning applications. The candidate will learn data analytics and machine learning with applications in climate risk.

What will you do?

  • Assist to research open-source data and analytics platforms, such as OS-Climate, Oasis, Climate Analytics CIE, WRI Aqueduct, World Bank CCKP.
  • Identify use cases of the open-source platforms.
  • Assist to design and implement Python-based tools for climate risk related applications.
  • Make presentation to senior people in risk

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong programming experience in Python and SQL.
  • Knowledge about machine learning, data analytics, and data visualization
  • Ability to communicate technical matters in written and oral forms
  • Team players to collaborate and innovate

Nice-to-have

  • Interest in learning about emerging data and techniques to assess climate risk impact.
  • Understand of the big picture regarding how risk function works in banks
  • Knowledge of financial products in trading book and banking book.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships

Job Summary

Apply data analytics and programming skills to empower our climate risk analytics capability. The intern student will be involved in researching climate risk methodology and developing Python-based tools for climate risk related analytics and machine learning applications.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Student/Coop (Fixed Term)

Pay Type:

Salaried

2023-05-18

2023-06-18

item.title: Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech

Job Description


RBC has made the strategic decision to become a Disruptor in the U.S. Cash Management space. By starting this journey, there is a significant opportunity to evolve and capitalize on a $100 Billion Dollar market segment in the U.S. In support of this vision, RBC aims to offer a frictionless, embedded payment and liquidity experience for its clients.  While RBC has an established Cash Management business in Canada, the U.S. based group will be built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling the Bank to compete with new entrants in this space.

What is the opportunity?

The US Cash Management (USCM) Technology team is undertaking a green field project to build a brand-new system to serve corporate clients. In this role, you will be responsible for the overall collection, accuracy, and reporting of USCM Tech initiatives. ​

Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements. Applies advanced in-depth and/or broad knowledge, considered a top resource across the organization.


What will you do?

  • Reporting and Shared Knowledge:
    • Manage the USCM Tech reporting calendar
    • Prepare routine internal portfolio reporting for team leadership on initiative status (financials, risks, benefits)
    • Coordinate portfolio reporting to senior executives (incl. T&O, Group Heads, Board of Directors, etc.)
    • Administer and maintain tools environment for enterprise reporting on behalf of USCM Tech team
    • Ensure consistent reporting processes, approach and tools are in place (factoring in regional differences)
    • Update tools and sites to support shared knowledge and ensure adherence and use of standardized tools and process
  • Data Analytics
    • Subject Matter Expert on gathering development of reporting tools, quality control and measurement of data.
    • Responsible for bringing leading industry best practices into reporting and analytics design solutions for USCM Tech to the table for senior management to review
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvements
  • Relationship and Communication
    • Provides executives and senior management with timely updates on project issues and manages communications including status reports
    • Effectively communicates and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and interface groups across USCM using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close
    • Interacts with executives and senior management on the full range of matters related to USCM Tech reporting and analytics
  • Operational Risk, Compliance and Audits
    • Ensures operational risk activities are effectively managed and addressed.
    • Proactively monitors and ensures risk management deadlines are met and issues resolved on a timely basis.

Must have:

  • Experience with financial operations
  • 7+ years of project management experience with at least 3-5 years’ experience with large projects portfolios
  • Demonstrated data analytic & reporting experience
    • Experience using Tableau, SharePoint, Microsoft Office suite, JIRA and Confluenence
  • Strong client-focus and responsiveness to business needs
    • Experience in dashboard development
  • Well-developed communication and presentation skills including executive interaction

Nice to have:

  • PMP Certified or equivalent
  • Basic financial accounting knowledge
  • Exposure to financial services and/or financial products.

What\'s in It for You?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Positive work culture emphasizing diversity and inclusion, volunteerism, and community involvement
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including great benefits, annual incentive program and recognition
  • Leaders who support your development
  • A dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and grow your career
  • Work-life integration

item.title: 2023 Global Asset Management, Fall Analytics Engineer (4 months)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

2023 Global Asset Management, Fall Analytics Engineer (4 months)

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Machine learning Platform Enhancement: to increase reusability and accelerate insight creation for GAM funds sales and marketing business.
  • Increase awareness of the Advanced Analytics capabilities: to experiment with NLP capabilities on feature mining and retrievals.
  • Developing, deploying, and maintaining data pipelines as well as building out our workflow framework to further the quality of our data assets and streamline the creation and delivery of the assets to end business users.
  • Performing research and providing answers for customer generated inquiries.
  • Contributing to ad-hoc tasks under direct supervision.
  • Documenting processes or upgrading existing procedure manuals.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Have a strong quantitative background, a degree in math/statistics/computer science/engineering would be a plus.
  • A minimum of 1-2 years of experience with Python and SQL (including school projects).
  • Desire to learn real industry data science and engineering practices.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with business users and technical individuals.
  • Ability to work effectively as an individual and on a team.

Nice-to-have:

  • Experience with Kubernetes, Docker
  • Basic understanding of Networks
  • Familiarity with MLOps/DevOps practices

item.title: 2023 CFO, Fall Benchmarking Strategy and Model Analytics Financial Analyst (4 Months)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

2023 CFO, Fall Benchmarking Strategy and Model Analytics Financial Analyst (4 Months)

Job Description

What will you do?

1.  Play a central oversight and collaboration role across teams within the department. This includes providing detailed data and analysis that will help other teams within the group enhance and transform their existing reporting processes and dialogue with key stakeholders.

2. Build a thorough knowledge of key Capital Markets businesses and financial reporting processes.

3. Be instrumental in advanced analytic capabilities that are used to support advisory functions to the Capital Market’s senior management team across Finance and the Front Office, Group Risk Management by aiding in the development and advancement of financial models and data inventories/dashboards.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Ability to convert financial data and knowledge into clear and concise messaging with actionable advice for business partners

  • Excellent problem solving and proven analytical skills, with a high degree of initiative

  • Solid data engineering / manipulation experience

  • Ability to work under pressure and demonstrate multi-tasking skill

  • Advance knowledge of MS Excel (VBA) and PowerPoint

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Nice-to-have

  • Programming experience in R or Python is an asset

  • Programming experience in SQL is an asset

  • Prior experience in discounted cash flow (DCF) model is a plus

  • Knowledge about Capital Markets businesses is a plus

  • Prior knowledge on Stress Testing models (EWST / CCAR) is a plus

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference

  • Opportunities to building close relationships

Job Summary

This is an exciting opportunity in Benchmarking Strategy and Model Analytics team under Capital Markets and Treasury Services Performance Management team. In this role, you will be at the forefront of delivering value-add inputs and support in developing model frameworks that enable our Finance leaders and advisory team to enhance the current forecasting and financial planning process as well as enrich the data strategy across the group and broader RBC enterprise. The ultimate goal of Capital Market’s financial modelling initiative is develop a future state where business forecasts are supported by bottoms-up macroeconomic data and models, and where financial advice, assessment and tracking business results, competitive benchmarking, real-time decision support, detailed analytics, and scenario / what-if attribution analysis can be tied to macroeconomic indicators. Data strategy efforts that the team leads are also focused on driving forward the “Future of Finance” in efforts to enrich the existing data infrastructure to promote greater value-add insights and advice offered by the team to senior management, the CFO and the Capital Market’s front office.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Office of the CFO

Student/Coop (Fixed Term)

Pay Type:

item.title: Senior Officer, Data Management & Quality
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Officer, Data Management & Quality

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will be working as part of the Data Management & Quality team. The purpose of the role is to ensure that all Client and Product data is input, controlled effectively and maintained appropriately for all WMI businesses and product lines.

UKJERSEYWM

What will you do?

  • Ensure the integrity of data across and between multiple systems is maintained

  • Complete data maintenance and supporting administrative tasks throughout the Client and Product lifecycle

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure that all issues, queries and obstacles are satisfactorily resolved to ensure that tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner

  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of an appropriate control environment in line with applicable data standards, regulatory requirements and business unit procedures

  • Contribute to the ongoing efficiency, innovations, process review and development of Data Management and Quality

  • Act as an SME to assist with Optimisation activities including the development of new RPA processes, Service Requests and core application development

  • Assist in the rotation and remediation of daily control reports and collation of task information for Management Information

  • Assist with the delivery and completion of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Post Implementation Verification (PIV) testing


What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Strong communication, influencing and negotiating skills

  • Collaborative and consultative approach along with team player attitude

  • Ability to make decisions, use initiative and escalate issues

  • Ability to execute tasks within defined service level agreements

  • A proven track record in excellent service delivery

  • Knowledge/experience with Client Due Diligence (CDD) / Know Your Client (KYC) and supporting documentation

  • Ability and willingness to work from home in line with the hybrid working team charter


Nice-to-have

  • An understanding of client structures, primarily companies and trusts

  • Knowledge of VB and macros

  • Knowledge/Understanding of JIRA

  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products — specifically Word and Excel

  • Knowledge and understanding of Salesforce, RIBS, Milvus, Triple A, 5 Series, and Content Navigator

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible working options fully supported

item.title: Manager, Control & Regulatory Initiatives, Global Business Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Control & Regulatory Initiatives, Global Business Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will be a part of RBC’s Investor Services Client Operations team where you will play a key role in managing the relationship with PwC with regards to the RBC Investor Services Report on Controls external audit, ensuring the successful completion of controls reporting on a semi-annual basis.  Additionally, you will play a key role in supporting the development and refinement of the short- and long-term strategic plan and new and existing strategic initiatives for the Investor Services Report on Controls.  You will perform operational risk, control/attestation activities, and manage internal control reporting to Client Operations SLT. You will look to monitor control & regulatory changes to ensure compliance with RBC Enterprise policies for Client Operations and implement these in collaboration with Operational Control, I&TS Compliance and other relevant key stakeholders across I&TS and RBC Enterprise. This role will drive continuous improvement and the delivery operational efficiencies, while challenging the status quo, within the control and regulatory environment in Client Operations.

What will you do?

  • Program Management for the Investor Services Report on Controls:
    • Support the planning, execution, completion and reporting of the semi-annual external audit controls reports.
    • Work closely with relevant IT partners and Client Operations managers related to external audit controls reporting, to ensure timely responses for populations and evidence are supplied and deadlines are met.
    • Act as trusted advisor to Client Operations managers/directors to provide recommendations on efficiencies and/or automation on external audit testing methodology.
    • Develop and lead internal training sessions for Client Operations.
  • Support the development and refinement of short and long-term strategic plan and new and existing strategic initiatives for the Investor Services Report on Controls:
    • Align with Client Operations strategic direction of the business, ensuring that all initiatives are feasible, value-add, tangible and driving towards the common goal of the business.
    • Work with the team to develop new strategic initiatives and business guidance/directions to address any of the gaps in place.  Ensure that all initiatives are actionable with a clear roadmap for execution (scope, budget, schedule, resources, and business cases).  All aligned with the overall strategic direction for the business.
    • Ensure that overall initiatives plan/roadmap is aligned to the business financial targets and deliverables.  Support ideations and projects scoping to address and communicate gaps to ensure full alignment.
  • Support the development, maintenance and enhancement of Client Operation control and process frameworks in collaboration with key stakeholders across RBC including the Global Business Management team, as applicable
  • Manage attestation of key risks, controls, internal audit and compliance requirements such as End User Developed Applications (EUDA’s), external audit and others as required
  • Assist in the development and analysis of KPIs for key controls for Client Operations, driving forward awareness and actions in areas requiring attention
  • Ensure that Client Operations’ control framework supports all regulatory and legislative requirements of local jurisdictions and implement effective audit controls in accordance with established guidelines and regulations
  • Support the production and analysis of the monthly internal control reports for Client Operations SLT and other key stakeholders
  • Support management within the implementation of new processes and project specific to the development and design of controls
  • Document processes that govern the activities within Client Operations assigned by management
  • Work to prevent, to detect, and to eliminate the potential for risk and liability to the organization and work closely with Operational Risk, Compliance, Internal & External Audit colleagues to design and implement best in class processes
  • Analyze, design, implement uniform and robust processes to ensure high degree of automated processing, and support the standardization and streamlining of work within C&RI
  • The delegate to peers when required with execution of responsibilities and any other aspects that may be required

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • University degree, plus 4+ years’ experience in a relevant industry
  • CPA designation or CPA candidate
  • Experience working on operational controls in the financial industry or in an audit firm
  • Ability to take ownership and solve complex problems        
  • Proficient time management and organizational skills
  • Strong work ethic and attention to detail
  • Strong relationship building
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Impact and influence, ability to challenge the status quo is a must have
  • Strong understanding of Operations environment

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Excellent exposure to communicate with various business partners and stakeholders in Investor & Treasury Services and within other platforms as appropriate
  • Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role
  • Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Competitive compensation

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Regular

Salaried
